trans-unit.source: Represents a command in an <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList"></xref> ASP.NET mobile control.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
An ObjectListCommand object can be declared as a `<command>` element within the declaration of an <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList>.

An ObjectListCommand object can be also constructed, and added programmatically to an <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList>, by adding it to the control's <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList.Commands%2A> member collection.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListCommand"></xref> class.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The default constructor initializes all properties to `null`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListCommand"></xref> class.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

The second constructor uses the name and text parameters to initialize the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListCommand.Name%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListCommand.Text%2A> properties, respectively.
Initializes the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListCommand.Name*> property.
Initializes the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListCommand.Text*> property.
Gets the name of the command.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The name is provided in the event that is generated when the user selects a command.
The name of the command.
Gets or sets the text that is to appear in the command.
The default is an empty string.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The Text property can be specified by using the `Text` attribute, or as inner text.
If the Text property is specified in both ways, the inner text always takes precedence.
However, if the Text property is programmatically set, the inner text is automatically removed and the newly set property takes precedence.
The text that is to appear in the command.
